disposal_steps: Do not throw used batteries in normal dustbin.
Do not crush, burn or puncture batteries.
Store them in a cool, dry place until disposal.
Drop them at designated battery recycling bins or authorised e-waste centres.
Battery.hazards: Batteries may leak toxic chemicals and pose fire risk.
Battery.tips: Tape the terminals to prevent short-circuits during storage.

disposal_steps: Disconnect the keyboard and remove any batteries if wireless.
Do not break or burn the plastic body.
Hand it over to an authorised e-waste collection centre.
Keyboard.hazards: Contains plastics and metals that pollute soil and water if dumped.
Keyboard.tips: If working, consider donating before recycling.

disposal_steps: Unplug and clean the microwave before disposal.
Do not try to dismantle internal parts yourself.
Take it to a registered e-waste recycler or municipal pickup service.
Microwave.hazards: Contains electronic circuits and materials that are not safe in landfills.
Microwave.tips: Check if local brands offer take-back or exchange programs.

disposal_steps: Backup data and perform a factory reset.
Remove SIM card and memory card.
Do not throw in normal garbage.
Deposit at authorised e-waste centre or brand collection kiosk.
Mobile.hazards: Contains heavy metals and chemicals harmful to health and environment.
Mobile.tips: If still functional, consider reuse or donation before recycling.

disposal_steps: Unplug the mouse and remove batteries if wireless.
Do not dispose with regular plastic waste.
Drop it at an e-waste collection centre.
Mouse.hazards: Plastic and electronic parts can release toxins when burnt or dumped.
Mouse.tips: Reuse or donate if still working.

disposal_steps: Do not burn or break PCBs.
Handle with care; avoid inhaling dust from broken boards.
Give them only to authorised e-waste recyclers.
PCB.hazards: Contains heavy metals and brominated flame retardants; highly polluting.
PCB.tips: Store in a box until you can hand them to a recycler.

disposal_steps: Remove batteries or power cables.
Do not dispose with household waste.
Hand over to an e-waste collection centre.
Player.hazards: Contains circuit boards, plastics and metals.
Player.tips: Check if it can be repaired or reused.

disposal_steps: Remove ink/toner cartridges and dispose them in dedicated collection programs.
Do not throw the printer in normal garbage.
Take the printer to an authorised e-waste recycler.
Printer.hazards: Electronic parts and residual toner/ink can be harmful if mismanaged.
Printer.tips: Some manufacturers offer take-back or exchange offers.

disposal_steps: Unplug and avoid breaking the screen.
Do not leave it on the roadside or in general trash.
Arrange pickup or drop-off at authorised e-waste centres.
Television.hazards: Screens and internal parts may contain hazardous substances.
Television.tips: Many cities have special drives for TV and large appliance collection.

disposal_steps: Disconnect water and power supply safely.
Do not dismantle heavy internal parts at home.
Contact municipal service or authorised recycler for pickup.
Washing Machine.hazards: Contains metals, electronics and plastic parts that should be recycled properly.
Washing Machine.tips: Check for buy-back or exchange schemes from appliance dealers.
